title: android_binary incorrectly depends on android_tools_defaults_jar in exec config

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

body:
This is blocking enabling Android platforms with the Starlark rules. A tool used in Android compilation depends on the current Android SDK, which cannot be discovered for tools (which are built in an exec configuration).

The [`android_binary`] rule, even with rules_android, is still [the native version](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/rules/android/BazelAndroidBinaryRule.java). This currently defines an attribute, [`$build_java8_legacy_dex`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/rules/android/AndroidRuleClasses.java;drc=0356a3ff1d978fe645f71a546680bd89391466dc;l=696), which uses the exec transition and depends on [`@bazel_tools////tools/android:build_java8_legacy_dex`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:tools/android/BUILD.tools;drc=7c1b139fc0a26b69131b62a019dac3ce9d31082d;l=202).

`build_java8_legacy_dex` is an `sh_binary`, so it's correct that this dependency uses the exec transition: it's a tool which is executed in a build action. However, this transitively depends on [`@bazel_tools//tools/android:android_jar`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:tools/android/BUILD.tools;drc=7c1b139fc0a26b69131b62a019dac3ce9d31082d;l=14), which is implemented by the [`android_tools_defaults_jar`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/rules/android/BazelAndroidToolsDefaultsJarRule.java).

Unfortunately, `android_tools_defaults_jar` is used to depend on the Android SDK, which cannot be found via toolchain resolution in the exec configuration.

It appears that this dependency is actually unused: adding a dummy SDK (like the dummy SDK currently added for the native `android_sdk_repository`) is sufficient to allow the build to complete. Alternately, we could try to remove the dependency if it is unused.

To demonstrate: clone https://github.com/katre/rules_android/tree/show-atdj
```
$ cd examples/basicapp
$ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=last_green bazelisk build --fat_apk_cpu=arm64-v8a //java/com/basicapp:basic_app 
2023/09/22 15:27:33 Using unreleased version at commit 48b2e857ebd2c0ca6835b2f2252b58a773d8a7c9
ERROR: /usr/local/google/home/jcater/repos/rules_android/examples/basicapp/java/com/basicapp/BUILD:3:15: While resolving toolchains for target //java/com/basicapp:basic_app: No matching toolchains found for types @bazel_tools//tools/android:sdk_toolchain_type.
To debug, rerun with --toolchain_resolution_debug='@bazel_tools//tools/android:sdk_toolchain_type'
If platforms or toolchains are a new concept for you, we'd encourage reading https://bazel.build/concepts/platforms-intro.

$ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=last_green bazel query --experimental_google_legacy_api --output=label_kind -- 'somepath(//java/com/basicapp:basic_app, @bazel_tools//tools/android:android_jar)'
2023/09/22 15:27:58 Using unreleased version at commit 48b2e857ebd2c0ca6835b2f2252b58a773d8a7c9
```
